WRITING.TEXT: Rocking the #8220;daddy packs my lunch for university #8221; look
I #8217;m pretty sure your mums wish they had aborted

So essentially you have a change in potential energy. Potential energy is the integral of Force, and the force in this case is simply F=Gmm/r^2. The intergral of this is U=-Gmm/r. The mass and velocity do not change so the kinetic energy remains the same. Because you are now in a completely different state you do not need to factor in conservation of energy between the r and 3r distance. If that was the case then clearly the orbital speed would slow down.

Unless of course the speed does not remain constant... then just make E=Ep+Ek where E is constant and work from there. It is a good idea to try and understand Keplers laws to get a feel for classical orbital motion.

WRITING.TITLE: My 16 yr old baby. His name is Derek and he loves it when you rub his ears.

WRITING.TEXT: I #8217;m glad to share my lovely boy with you. He #8217;s such a gentle soul and is very deaf but still rolls over for me to rub his belly.
And they are always the most calm and understanding.
Can confirm all ear rubs were delivered. One for each of you.

It #8217;s amazing how much they connect with us. Truly humble and loving creatures. The way I think about it when they pass (having lost two of my babies already) is that they aren #8217;t and were never ours. They come into our lives and brighten them up and we do our best to protect them from the harshness of the world. But when the time comes we let them go. We don #8217;t deserve the love from dogs if we look at how we treat other animals. But it #8217;s always a comfort to remember that you gave that dog everything you could in order for him/her to be happy. And knowing that you can love something so much and be loved back makes us as humans feel like we aren #8217;t so bad after all. I #8217;m on a little tangent here. The first dog I ever got was a staffie named Piggie. She was absolutely amazing. So calm and also quite grumpy- but had an amazing sense of humor. The day she went was the first time I saw my dad cry. If I had a chance to spend 5 minutes with someone who has departed I would choose to see her over any other person. I find it difficult to understand people who are critical of human-dog relationships. There has never been anything more amazing to come out of life than having a dog as a best friend.

At the end of the day just make sure that you give the people you care about in your life what they have always deserved. You can hire some one anonymously to do it if you are worried about questions. Life will always be out of control. Do what you can now to help the people you love to be happy. All the money in the world won #8217;t replace the feeling of doing that. You have the opportunity to have both! The more positivity you spread with your means the more security you will receive. All the best. Treat yourself. And only ever invest in index funds (brokers are lotteries within themselves)

First question: The physics is understood. But no, quantum mechanics is not macro. Otherwise weird things would happen... like a ball bouncing higher than the height it was dropped. Entropy is macro. And we are governed by that. It will never be the case where quantum mechanics becomes tangible. 2nd: I do think that the world in some senses is only around when we observe it. Our bodies are attuned to receiving waves at different frequencies and our brain filters them into useful information. But other creatures perceive differently. However one #8217;s direct presence doesn #8217;t mean the wave isn #8217;t emitted. But... alas I #8217;m still clueless. 3rd: space time is a thing. We can #8217;t really conquer all because of it. We will never be able to control time and space. We can try to understand it though. Space time is actually the relationship between time and space and often we think of it as space never being able to move faster than light, so that #8217;s always the upper bound for space.
Yes.

I #8217;m no specialist, but I study 3rd year Physics. A humanities major, who had done a metaphysics course, was going on about the possibilities of time travel and how close we are to being able to travel back and forth in time... must of been a YouTube video... Anyways, I listened and gritted my teeth but eventually it got to the point where I had to say something. We agreed that one would have to travel at the speed of light for any meaningful time travel to be made. I then told him that that would make one #8217;s mass infinite... He got pretty sulky after that.

WRITING.TITLE: How to be a Physics lecturer:

WRITING.TEXT: Ah well. 3rd year major and this is what it #8217;s like for me. Perhaps quite specific. But thought would be nice to share.
Slinky= springs used as models

Yeah, I #8217;m at UCT (south Africa). Quite a great physics department. They do a lot of work with CERN. I guess this meme would resonate with more members of the class. We just wrote a relativistic EM exam where only the last week of work was tested. Needless to say, making memes is a way of expressing annoyance.
I guess we all are different.
What is your major?
And the most irritating ones.
They are what ever the lecturer feels like at that moment. Usually dummy variables.
Ok, well we all have different experiences I guess. Would like to see what you would have put on it? Sorry if you couldn #8217;t relate.
You clearly have a lecturer with neat handwriting.
They do. All of them. One of my lecturers didn #8217;t know how to rotate a PDF.... ah but they are masters of Labview, latex and you know physics. But laziness is also something I missed out....

WRITING.TITLE: Stern Gerlach experiment: Uniform magnetic field at an angle
WRITING.TEXT: My 3rd year class and I are writing Atomic on wednesday: No one has been able to make ends of the solution we were provided with for this question: A beam of spin-1 particles, moving along the y axis, is incident on two collinear SG apparatuses, the first with B feild along the z axis and the second with B along the z' axis, which lies in the xz plane at an angle `$\theta$` relative to the z axis. Both apparatuses transmit only the uppermost beams. What fraction leaving the first will pass the second? #8203; The solution given: Particles exciting the first filter will be in the (1, 0, 0)\^t (transpose) state (S(z) basis). Particles passing the filter will be in the eigenstate of the `$B \cdot S$` opperator, which is = B(cos \* S(z) + sin \* S(x)) (which becomes a matrix of cos and sin). The solution then states that the spin up eigen vector is 1/2(1+cos, sqrt(2) sin, 1-cos). Then the inner product \^2 of this with the spin up z basis vector is 1/4 (1+cos(theta))\^2. #8203; Where we loose the plot: \- Why is (001) spin up in S(z). This seems so trivial but working with spin-one is confusing. How can this be show. Any explicit resources that anyone knows of? #8203; \- From the matrix B(cos \* S(z) + sin \* S(x)), how does one extract the spin up eigen vector... I have tried Gaussian reduction and looked online... nothing. #8203; Thanks so much if you are able to help. Spin is so elusive and really not explicit explained for spins other than spin-1/2.
Ok. That makes sense when looking at the matrix. Thanks. Any idea about the other?
Yes we have. All from Lie algebra context. Just haven #8217;t seen a worked example on such... I will have a look. Thanks so much.
Yeah fining the matrix isn #8217;t difficult. The difficulty I find is extracting spin up from it.

WRITING.TITLE: Still charged for purchase cancelled by cashier.
WRITING.TEXT: So I bought some items at a pharmacy which totaled to R790 (South African rands) however the cashier didn #8217;t notice one item after I had pushed in my pin to pay. She cancelled it on the device and I got an error receipt. She added the item and said I would receive the balance of the cancelled purchase as soon as it bounced back on the system. I repaid with added item. Two days later no such reflection in my account. I kept all the receipts and the error code from the card machine from the first swipe. I called the pharmacy and they said they would investigate and get back to me. They haven #8217;t. I #8217;m a student and it #8217;s quite a large amount of money for me but I will struggle with transport to get back to the pharmacy itself. I #8217;m not sure what to do here... I feel like I shouldn #8217;t have to physically go in and deal with the issue since it is their issue and they have my money. I live in South Africa, does anyone have any advice? What are my rights in this situation?
This is very overdone
She #8217;s made of wood!

WRITING.TITLE: Want free software? Never search #8216;free #8216;. You often will just get trials where you have to pay after a week. Always search #8216;open source #8217;. You will never be disappointed.
